column4: does somebody know how to make gdesklets start automatically every time I restart???
go to your sessions menu and add there
- I'm sorry, but I don't know how to do that, I'm using X-Chat
- Yes, version 5.10, but I never used this program before...
- I was answering your question about how to start gdesklets automatically when a session starts.
- Oh thanks, could you tell me how to do that? Is bcause is very annoing to start manually every time
- from the gnome or ubuntu menu choose system, then choose preferences, then choose session
- Oh I see! but... the thing is that since Gdesklets is on the Programs menu, I can't find on that dialogue (startup programs)

you are not looking for start up menu.  You are looking for the systems menu.  At the bottom or top of your screen there is a panel or menu bar that has the ubuntu logo, then <applications> <places> <system>....  yes?
- yes, I found that place on System>Preferences>Sesions>Programs at startup right?
you want the <System> menu  from there you want the <Preferences> menu from there choose <Sessions>
- click the add button then type <gdesklests> in the Startup command box
- ok, what about the order? (it says 50), I left it as is.
thank you very much for your help, you've been very nice!
- I am a newbie too.  I just happened to have figured out that exact thing last week.
